page.title: 03GAMEKEEPING 1
page.content: In February the gamekeeper catches the pheasants for breeding. From April to July is the rearing season. At about two weeks old,the chicks have bits put in their beaks to prevent them from pecking one another.They are kept in a shed,given water three times a day and fed,firstly on very fine meal,then on pellets.During the shooting season,the pheasants continue to be fed,mainly on barley. When they are about six weeks old,the bits are removed,their beaks are burned electrically,and the three outside feathers on one wing are clipped to prevent them from flying. They are put into release pens on the hills. The pheasant shooting season begins on October the first and continues until February.About eight days of shooting take place in this area.
